cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: ur-{d}lamma-ra {d}lamma ki-gal-la-ta [...]
ulutim sa6 alan za3-še3#! gar AN {geš}gal#? [...]
nar sag keš2 i3-gal2 šir3 nam-nar PI-PI |MUŠxMUŠ| BI? x [...]
kin2? mah kin2? galam eme SUH dara3 banda3{+da} za3 GALAM? x [...]
{d}šul-gi aš-ba a2 TE me di#?-ir-ga HI? RI IM#? [...]
RI? šu UN NE NIR x TAR? IG x x SILA3? balag? mu x [...]
{d}šul!-gi ki-ur3-ba x AN NUN kun? na5 de5-ga x he2-me-[...]
ul |GA2xX| kalam-ma UD bar-ra-na NE x TUK bi2-in-x x [...]
e2?-bur?-se3-ga-ra ki x nam SI?-A na5{+na} de5 {geš#}UL-bi x [...]
TIR? GAN?-GAN da RI LUL-bi na RU e EN? ša3 x [...]
|U.GA| dara3 banda3{+da} |SAL.LAGAR| la2 DU URU-nam nam SI?-A la2 [...]
dingir ša3-ne-ša4 a RU? bar!?-re TE? geš-nu11 BAD? x [...]
|ŠITAxUD| {d}nun-bar-še-gu-nu [...]
x x x i x x x [...]
a#?-lal3? gi-x-ne x [...]
x NE DAR? SILA3? x u2 gi a x x [...]
KID2 x x x-na a |GIŠGALxX| x BU a NIG2? [...]
kun-zi-de3 ku6#? nu-me-a x [...]
suhur-la2 in#?-TU? x x nu#?-tuku#? x x da x [...]
x GA2 NE x hul-gal2 x x [...]
si? du5? x x x x x x x ra x x x x [...]
SI RU zu#? ME ra mud la2#? x ⸢ur3⸣ x ga a RI x x [...]
ŠEŠ?-zu gir2? gal GI KA gig? AN da-ra x x x [...]
|KAxX|#? KU? x sa?-hir#? šu IN ša-ra x x x x x [...]
x RU#? na IN LA x NIR NE x x x x [...]
ur#?-e2-un#?-nu11#?-si x ba#? x x a x x [...]
x x im?-DU x x bur NIG2? x-ra#?-na x da#? x x [...]
[...] x x GI x x MU x a x x x [...]
x x TE#? ti-la-bi#? a#? [...]
ur!-{d}lamma-ra geš2-da-am3 x [...]
PAD?-gu10 ga-i-i x [...]
[...] x-ta mu-ši-mah ka-ta mu#?-[...]
[...] x geštux(|TUG2.PI|)?-mah {d}en-ki-ke4 kikki? ga sag-e-eš SILA3? x [...]-⸢rig7⸣ [...]
For/that of(?) Ur-Lamma, the lamma protective deity, from/at (remotely) the platform(?) ...
Beautiful features, a statue set in place, ... stand(?) ...
The “careful”(?) singer is present, the “song of musicianship” ...
The supreme work(?), the crafty/elaborate work(?), (done in) the ... dialect/vocabulary(?), the “junior/rampant wild goat” (Enki?) ...
Shulgi, alone(?), ... the rites and observances(?) ...
... the balag drum(?) ...
Shulgi ... in its Ki'ur building/foundations(?), ...., purified/set aside(?) ... you shall be(?)
The ... joy(?) of the land, the daylight? of/on his back(?) ...
For(?) the “temple/shrine where the stone vessels are placed” the place ... purified/set apart ...
... the “junior/rampant wild goat” (Enki?), the emeš/usuh priestess(?) ...
The god who... compassion(?) ... light/eyesight ...
... Nunbaršegunu (Nisaba) ...
The alal structure/stone/pipe/water hoisting device(?) ...
At the weir/dam there are no fish(?), ...
The (wearer of?) the suhurla hairstyle(?) ... who does not have ...
... evil ...
... the carrying net(?) ...
Ur-Enenusi(?)...
For/that of(?) Ur-Lamma, ... is sixty(?) ...
... I shall praise my ...
Apart from/by means of ... made superior on behalf of ...(?), ... from the mouth(?)
... superior wisdom(?) given as a gift ... by Enki ...(?)
